de.fuberlin.panda.metadata.parsedMetadata

Class XMLMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fuberlin.panda.metadata.parsedMetadata.ParsedMetadata
      • de.fuberlin.panda.metadata.parsedMetadata.XMLMetadata

  • public class XMLMetadata
extends ParsedMetadata
    This class extends the abstract class ParsedMetadata. It searches in a XML File (which path has to be set in the xmlFilePath field) for a given URI and parses all relevant information concerning this URI in the systems data classes.
    Since:
    06.09.2013
    Author:
    Sebastian Schulz
    See Also:
    parseMetadata(), parseMetadataNode(NodeList), checkForUri(), checkNodeNameForDataNode(Node), getNextRelevantNode(), checkForProcessingRelevantComment(Node), processNextMetadataSequence(String), processOperationalSequence(), getCharacterData(Node), processAdministrativeScopeSequence(), processArealScopeSequence(), processTemporalScopeSequence(), processTypeSequence(), processSemanticSequence()

    • Method Detail

      • parseMetadata

        public void parseMetadata()
                   throws MetadataNotFoundException,
                          ProcessingUriException
        This overridden method creates a document builder on the XML file which was set in the xmlFilePath field. Afterwards it checks if a root node could be found and then it calls the parseMetadataNode(NodeList) method for every panda:Metadata node which is included in the document.
        Specified by:
        parseMetadata in class ParsedMetadata
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - if there was a problem while setting up the parser
        java.io.IOException - if the file couldn't be opened
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - if the document builded couldn't be set up
        javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException - if the document doesn't have a root element
        MetadataNotFoundException
        ProcessingUriException

      • parseMetadataNode

        protected void parseMetadataNode(org.w3c.dom.NodeList childNodeList)
                          throws MetadataNotFoundException,
                                 javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException,
                                 java.net.URISyntaxException
        This method is responsible for the processing of a single panda:Metadata node. It calls checkForUri() to check if the requested URI is contained in this list and calls processNextMetadataSequence(String) to parse the metadata, if the URI is contained.
        Parameters:
        childNodeList - - a list of all child nodes of panda:Metadata
        Throws:
        MetadataNotFoundException - in case there exists no metadata for the given uri
        javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException - in case their was a problem while parsing the document
        java.net.URISyntaxException - in case a URI couldn't be parsed because of invalid format

      • checkForUri

        protected boolean checkForUri()
        This method checks if the node list contains the requested URI and return a boolean value.
        Returns:
        a boolean - true if the URI is included, otherwise false

      • checkNodeNameForDataNode

        protected boolean checkNodeNameForDataNode(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        This method checks if a node is a "panda:Data" note and returns a boolean value.
        Parameters:
        node - - a node of the node list
        Returns:
        a boolean - true, if the nodes name is "panda:Data", false otherwise

      • getNextRelevantNode

        protected org.w3c.dom.Node getNextRelevantNode()
        This method gets the next comment node from the node list and returns it's value as a string.
        Returns:
        nodeValue - the proper comment

      • checkForProcessingRelevantComment

        protected boolean checkForProcessingRelevantComment(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        This method checks if a comment node is relevant for further processing. In this case the string value matches to one of the values in MetadataType.
        Parameters:
        node - - the current node which is examined
        Returns:
        a boolean - true if the comment matches, false otherwise

      • processNextMetadataSequence

        protected void processNextMetadataSequence(java.lang.String startComment)
                                    throws javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException
        This method calls a method to process a sequence of the node list depending on the startComment.
        Parameters:
        startComment - - A comment in the document which introduces the following metadata sequence
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException
        javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException

      • processOperationalSequence

        protected void processOperationalSequence()
                                   throws javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException
        This method is responsible to parse the operational metadata. It creates a new Operations object and parses all found values from the document in to objects operations list.
        Throws:
        javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException - in case the operational timestamp has a wrong format

      • getCharacterData

        protected java.lang.String getCharacterData(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        This method parses the CDATA from a given XML node and returns it's value as a string.
        Parameters:
        node - - the current node.
        Returns:
        a string of the CDATA of the given node and "?" if there was no CDATA

      • processAdministrativeScopeSequence

        protected void processAdministrativeScopeSequence()
                                           throws javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException
        This method is responsible to parse the administrative scope sequence. It creates a new AdministrativeScope object and parses all found values from the document in to object data URI's.
        Throws:
        javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException - in case the URI has a wrong format and couldn't be parsed

      • processArealScopeSequence

        protected void processArealScopeSequence()
                                  throws javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException
        This method is responsible to parse the areal scope sequence. It calls the getCharacterData(Node) to get the String value from every areal data node and parses it to the ArealScope object.
        Throws:
        javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException - in case processNextMetadataSequence(String) causes a exception

      • processTemporalScopeSequence

        protected void processTemporalScopeSequence()
                                     throws javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException
        This method is responsible to parse the temporal scope sequence. It creates a new TemporalScope object and parses the expiration date from the document in the object.
        Throws:
        javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException - in case the timestamp couldn't be parsed

      • processTypeSequence

        protected void processTypeSequence()
                            throws javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException
        This method is responsible to parse the type sequence. It creates a new Type object and parses all found information in it.
        Throws:
        javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException - in case processNextMetadataSequence(String) causes a exception

      • processSemanticSequence

        protected void processSemanticSequence()
                                throws javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException
        This method is responsible to parse the all the remaining data nodes which represent further semantic metadata information. It creates a SemanticDescription object and adds all nodes.
        Throws:
        javax.management.modelmbean.XMLParseException - in case

      • getXmlFilePath

        public java.lang.String getXmlFilePath()
